one.title: FIRST DAY: Read the notes and the references.

questions.questionText: 1. Use this space to record how you have seen God's activity during the week. (How has He provided, answered, comforted, reconciled, guided, etc.?)
2. From the past week's study, what made the most significant impact to you in the notes, lecture, group sharing or personal study?

two.title:
SECOND DAY: Read 1 Samuel 18.
David experienced strained relations with Saul and strong relationships with Saul's children.

questions.questionText: 3. What is most interesting to you concerning David's relationships with Saul, Jonathan and Michal. Why?
4. What lessons or warnings do you learn from Saul? In what area of your life could you apply these lessons?
5. How does David experience both the blessing and cost of following God? How have you seen both the blessing and cost of following Jesus in your own life?

three.title:
THIRD DAY: Read 1 Samuel 19 with Psalm 59.
Saul's children protected David from their father.

questions.questionText: 6. What risks did Jonathan and Michal take to protect David?
7. Where is God calling you to do what is right even at personal cost or risk to yourself?
8. How does Psalm 59 deepen your insight into David's faith and the danger he faced? How did David's faith strengthen him?
9. How might describing and naming God in your prayers transform your present outlook?

four.title:
FOURTH DAY: Read 1 Samuel 20.
David and Jonathan prepared a plan to protect David from Saul.

questions.questionText: 10. What do you learn about Jonathan through his words and actions? What do you find most commendable? (1 Samuel 18-20)
11. Why would Jonathan give loyalty to David instead of Saul? What does Jonathan seem to understand about David? (Use any Scripture reference.)
12. What does David's and Jonathan's relationship teach you about true friendship?

five.title:
FIFTH DAY: Read Psalms 23 and 36.
David praised God for His protection and love.

questions.questionText: 13. How does David describe God's tender care in Psalm 23? Which aspect of God's care is most meaningful to you?
14. How does David's understanding of the sinfulness of the wicked compare to your view of sin? (Psalm 36)
15. How does David's understanding of God help you today?

six.title: SIXTH DAY: Review 1 Samuel 18-20 with Psalms 23, 36, and 59.

questions.questionText: 16. What have you learned in this week's study about God or about the suffering of every believer?
